overview:
Matthew is the Founding Principal at Tamra-Tacoma Capital Partners, where he is responsible for overseeing Tamra-Taccoma’s alternative technology investment activities, investment strategies, and project management efforts.

Matthew has proven experience in managing innovative start-up initiatives and large investment funds, particularly those in the clean energy sector where he held senior adviser and management roles. Most notably, Matthew was a Founding Member and Chief Marketing Officer at PACEhub, an incubator for PACE, a U.S. cleantech adoption promoting an innovative federally-funded, bipartisan, city/county-wide financing mechanism.

In 2009, Matthew assumed the role of Managing Director at Lestis Wind, Hydro, & Solar, a fund focused on the development of alternative power plants utilizing wind, run-of-river, and solar technology.

Matthew actively promotes social corporate responsibility and sits on the board of several non-profits often providing marketing, finance, and strategy consulting services. He also serves as an adviser and a consultant for many organizations, including Tire Rack Street Survival, the nation’s largest non-profit teen driver performance enhancement course.

In 2008, Matthew attended Texas Christian University (TCU) in Fort Worth, Texas and studied Entrepreneurial Management at TCU’s Neeley School of Business.

In addition to pursuing business interests, Matthew enjoys spectator-sports, extreme skydiving, and world traveling – he’s also an avid golfer and is a recreational pilot.
